From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>

Hello Markus,

Schemeless protocol-relative urls have been handled in heritrix for a
very long time. However there was a bug fixed in 2012
that affected protocol-relative urls with colons in them. See
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER-2013. That bug is fixed in the
3.2.0 release.

Noah

On Tue, May 27, 2014 at 2:12 AM, 'Markus.Mirsberger'
markus.mirsberger@... [archive-crawler]
<archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> recently I noticed in one of my crawls these kinds of URLs with a leading
> double slash.
> I never saw this before but after some research I read that this can and
> will be used to inherit the protocol.
> Heritrix handles these urls the same as it would be a relative path which
> leads of course to a 404 error.
> e.g. http://de.wikipedia.org//ace.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawan:Afrika
>
> So my question is if this there is a reason that this is not implemented and
> what would be the best place to implement it in your opinion?
> My first idea was to fix this probably inside the ExctractorHTML Module
> where the new URLs are extracted.
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
>
>
